name: Tea Party Sandwiches (Puerto Rican Version)
author: Mrs. Good
summary: This is an old recipe passed on from my mom; easy, tasty, and kids love them!!
ingredients: 1 (12 ounce) can fully cooked luncheon meat (such as SPAM®), cubed
1 (16 ounce) jar processed cheese sauce (such as Cheez Whiz®)
1 (4 ounce) jar chopped pimiento peppers with liquid
¾ cup mayonnaise-style sandwich spread with chopped sweet pickle
1 teaspoon dried parsley, or to taste
directions: Place luncheon meat cubes, processed cheese sauce, pimientos, and sandwich spread in a blender; pulse to blend into a smooth mixture, stopping often to scrape down blender sides
Spread the mixture onto 15 slices of white bread; top each with a slice of whole wheat bread
Press sandwiches together lightly and cut off crusts
Slice sandwiches in half diagonally to make triangles; sprinkle sandwiches with parsley flakes and top each sandwich half with a piece of sliced cucumber
